message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique. I believe it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to start the negotiation at a price of $800000. What do you think?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $600000. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm afraid I can't accept your offer of $600000. I'm willing to consider a price of $700000, which is still a significant discount from my original price. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $650000?

I understand your budget constraints, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer the product to you for $675000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, and I believe it's still a great value for the product. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to come down to $660000?

I understand your budget constraints, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer the product to you for $670000. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower. What do you think?
I appreciate your final concession, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to come down to $665000?

I'm sorry, Bob, but I've already made my final offer. I'm not willing to go any lower than $670000. I think that's a fair price considering the value of the product. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'm afraid I'll have to consider other options. What do you think?
I understand you've made your final offer, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to make one last attempt to meet you in the middle. Would you be willing to come down to $660000?
